ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Logging Out Of Scope
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Adam, You can just uncomment org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.LinksScoper.level = INFO in the heritrix.properties, and set LinksScoper s override-logger to

Hi Adam,

You can just uncomment 
org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.LinksScoper.level = INFO
in the heritrix.properties, and set LinksScoper's override-logger to 
true to isolate LinksScoper logging. All out-of-scope links will be 
logged to the org.archive.crawler.postprocessor.LinksScoper.log file 
within the *logs* directory.  Be sure that all other logging 
characteristics in the heritrix.properties are set to your needs.

Keep in mind that this list will probably grow very large with a lot of 
duplicate entires. If you want to reduce the logging output see 
scope-rejected-url-rules within LinksScoper. For example, you can add 
regex decide rule like ^.*\.jpg$  and only URLs that that are 
out-of-scope and end with .jpg will be logged.

I hope this helps.

Take care,
i.



goblin_cz wrote:
> Hallo, I've got a question..
> 
> How to log every link that haven't been downloaded in a crawl? The
> reason why is important too.
> I'm download only sites that ends with .cz, but we are developing a
> decide rule, that can make a decision whether the page is useful for
> czech archive (based on some country settings, language recognition
> and so on). So the plan is: make a crawl of whole czech domains (380k
> 2.level domains) and catch every link that is out of scope and than
> make crawl with the czech decide rule with catched links as seeds.
> Another reasons logging is useful too (deduplicator, quota enforcer,
> regexp,...)
> 
> And is possible to override logger settings for LinkScoper? (count,
> file location,..)
> 
> Thanks a lot for answers,
> 
> Adam
> 
> 
> 
>  
> Yahoo! Groups Links
> 
>
